text.p: Rentech Inc said Thursday it had received four new patents from the U.S. Patent Office including the production of a diesel fuel using its iron-based catalyst and gas conversion.
Rentech said a second patent protected its method of "cracking" or converting all or select portions of the wax produced by its technology into clean diesel fuel.
A third covered a method to prepare and activate its iron-based catalyst that increases liquid hydrocarbon yield from gas conversion while reducing pollutants and industrial "off gases," it said.

The fourth patent protected its method in using its synthesis reactor to produce an oxygenated diesel fuel from an iron-based catalyst that can be used as a blending stock to raise the quality of commercial grade diesel fuel.
